channel.title: TFS Top Tip #2: Changing the Logged In User
channel.description: When you connect to a Team Foundation Server, the Microsoft client API attempts to connect with your current credentials that the process is running with under Windows.  If you are on a different domain than your TFS server or the user...
channel.dc:creator: Martin

item.title: Comment by anon+00:00
item.description: Good tip, thank you for posting it. Here's another way: Use runas /user:domain\username cmd.exe. This gives you a command prompt as a different user. Then use tf.exe from that command prompt. You can spawn multiple and simultaneous command prompts as various users and party on TFS from each one. Cheers.
item.dc:creator: anon
